meanings.definition: A family of spiders, including orb-weavers and tarantulas.
meanings.sent1: Araneids build intricate webs to catch their prey.
meanings.sent2: I saw a variety of araneids in the garden, from tiny orb-weavers to large tarantulas.
meanings.sent3: The araneids in the attic were having a family reunion, spinning webs all over the place!
meanings.sent4: The forest was a kingdom of araneids, each spider a ruler of its own web domain.
meanings.sent5: The araneids scurried across the forest floor, their eight legs moving gracefully in the moonlight.

meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of spiders.
meanings.sent1: The araneids silk was strong and sticky, perfect for catching insects.
meanings.sent2: The araneids behavior was fascinating to observe, as they carefully spun their webs.
meanings.sent3: The araneids party was a hit, with everyone dressed in spider-themed costumes.
meanings.sent4: Her room was decorated with araneids artwork, from spider sculptures to web-shaped rugs.
meanings.sent5: The araneids presence in the house brought both fear and wonder to the residents.
